lexUnit.name: face.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the front part of a person's head from the forehead to the chin, or the corresponding part in an animal.

sentence.text: She leaned her face against the doorframe .
Maura rubbed her face against his cheek and felt his stubble scratching against her smooth skin .
He buried his face against her throat , his mouth tormenting her with its lazy progress down towards the swell of her breasts , and she arched up , silently begging for his caress .
Robyn closed her eyes , leaning her face against his shirt , and felt the thud of his heart beneath the fabric , smelt the clean , fresh maleness of his body .
The window on the driver 's side was lowered to reveal the unmistakable face of Jack Butler .
Nathan rubbed his face .
I found myself wandering round with a wry smile on my face and occasionally bursting into laughter at my own presumption .
Then , seeing Harriet 's face : ` Well , all right , but you are n't to do anything , mind . "
` At least you 're honest enough to want to end one affair before starting another -- " He broke off abruptly , his eyes narrowing as they rested on her tense face .

In their calm faces I can find no clues

His mongrel face was full of concern .
She was seen as a light relief from the boredom or demands of the shift , and , as a female , she was treated as a pretty face in a working environment which is heavily masculine .
Mrs Macpherson bit her blue lips with her artificial teeth and looked down her beaky nose at the bland , well-powdered face beside her .
I thought of his sweetness in sitting beside me all night , and of the shadows on his face in the morning , and how I had gone off without telling him I loved him .
She recalled the desperation on Amy 's face behind the car wheel last night .
He stretched , turning his face up to the sun .
And he smiled at her , but his eyes left Ellie 's face for only one moment .

They left ` The Tip " if you recall , with egg on their faces after securing a pitiful 6-2 victory over us .

He picked up the tins ; then , leaning towards her , he said , ` Nice to be served by a pretty face .
His strong , square face looked drawn and his thinning brown hair had n't been combed .
Mr Utterson looked at his friend 's red , angry face .
She rinsed her hands and face , and combed her windblown curls into a smooth feathery cap .
Nothing perturbed him , and he had a sphinx-like face , with amber eyes which seemed to look into your soul .
She had a pleasant untidy face and chubby warm hands that were nice to touch .
It 's no surprise I had a frown on my face . "
She had a rather broad face , pale as cream , and dotted with freckles .
Rosie had an open cheerful face that could n't lie .
It depicted simply an enormous face , more than a metre wide : the face of a man of about forty-five , with a heavy black moustache and ruggedly handsome features .
His hair was very fair , his face naturally sanguine , his skin roughened by coarse soap and blunt razor blades and the cold of the winter that had just ended .
On each landing , opposite the lift-shaft , the poster with the enormous face gazed from the wall .
